page.title: 13WRITTLE BY-PASS
page.content: In 1978 the road from Ongar to Writtle was made into the A415. This meant that Writtle was now on the main route that drivers would take if they wanted to join the new M11 motorway. People were sure that this would mean that more and more traffic would use the the village and that if this happened it would be bad for the community. A committee was set up to campaign for a Writtle by-pass to be constructed as soon as possible. In June 1985 Writtle residents were given something to celebrate when they heard that a four and a half million pound by-pass, designed to free the village from heavy traffic had been given the go ahead.The by-pass is scheduled for completion in 1987.
